thread.title: ISL 2: Delhi Dynamos beat FC Pune City 2-1 in important tie
thread.title_full: ISL 2: Delhi Dynamos beat FC Pune City 2-1 in important tie

author: PTI
title: ISL 2: Delhi Dynamos beat FC Pune City 2-1 in important tie
text:
PTI | October 15, 2015, 14.02 pm Delhi marquee manager-cum-player Roberto Carlos played Robin as the lone striker in this all-important tie. (Photo: ISL) Pune: Robin Singh scored on return from national duty while Richard Gadzie proved to be the 'Super Sub' with a late goal as Delhi Dynamos notched up a narrow 2-1 win over FC Pune City in the Indian Super League (ISL) football on Wednesday. This was Dynamos' second win in three outings, while the Pune suffered their first defeat at home at the Balewadi Stadium.
India striker Robin scored his debut ISL goal in the 23rd minute to put the visitors ahead and then a late strike from substitute Gadzie (90'+7') settled the closely contested affair in Dynamos' favour.
Kalu Uche (90'+8') scored a last-gasp consolation goal for the hosts. Configured in a 4-3-3 formation, Diego Colotto and Gouramangi Singh formed the core of the defense for the home side.
The Stallions are all set to host the Lions tonight! Check out the LIVE images from the FC Pune City vs Delhi Dynamos here.For more, visit: http://goo.gl/H4lzbD#PUNvDEL #LetsFootball
Posted by ISL- Indian Super League on Wednesday, October 14, 2015 Dharmaraj Ravanan and Nicky Shorey were the two full-backs, while James Bailey, Lenny Rodrigues and Manish Maithani patrolled midfield. Wesley Verhoek and Uche, who were earning their first starts for the side in the ISL, were the attackers.
Delhi marquee manager-cum-player Roberto Carlos played Robin as the lone striker in this all-important tie. Norwegian John Arne Riise, Hans Mulder, Gustavo Santos and Florent Malouda all featured for their side while Sanjiban Ghosh's injury meant Spanish stopper Toni Doblas got his first start.
The first strike happened when Delhi's number nine headed into the bottom corner, leaving the Pune City defenders stunned.
Tags: football Delhi Dynamos FC Pune City Robin Singh Indian Super League ISL 2: Sachin, Rajini team up with Bollywood in glamorous opening ceremony Loading... Please Wait 1/15 Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's breathtaking moves complemented AR Rahman's soulful music as the country's who's who from various fields got together for football to kick off the second season of Indian Super League (ISL) with a brief opening ceremony on Saturday in Chennai. (Photo: PTI) 2/15 Even as the beautiful Aishwarya sparkled by dancing to her hit numbers such as Dola Re Dola, Dhoom Dhoom, the highlight of the evening was music maestro Rahman performing the national anthem at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium here. (Photo: ISL) 3/15 The 45-minute programme was attended by, among others, Sachin Tendulkar, Rajinikanth, Mukesh and Nita Ambani, besides the Bachchan family. (Photo: PTI) 4/15 The initial part of the programme saw a performance by Bansi Kaul's troop. (Photo: ISL) 5/15 Young bollywood actor Alia Bhatt gyrated to some of her hits from movies like Student of the Year, besides performing to the ISL theme song 'Let's Football'. (Photo: PTI) 6/15 The franchises owners of opening day fixture between Atletico de Kolkata and Chennaiyin FC were called on to the stage and introduced by host Arjun Kapoor, following which Aishwarya entered the scene. (Photo: PTI) 7/15 "Together with your support we will make ISL a success," said Nita Ambani, the inspiration behind the initiative and founder chairperson of Football Sports Development. (Photo: ISL) 8/15 Heartthrob Rajinikanth hugging cricket legend and Kerala Blasters' co-owner Tendulkar and cine star Aishwarya were some of the worthy moments of the show. (Photo: ISL) 9/15 Rajinikanth was seen on a vintage car promoting the sport with a football in his hand with fans going crazy in the stands. (Photo: ISL) 10/15 The noise level reached a crescendo as two of India's greatest icons -- Rajinikanth and Bachchan -- took centre stage in front of 15,000-20,000 people and shared a word or two. (Photo: ISL) 11/15 Earlier, after a few hundred kids unfurled the team banners of all the eight outfits of the ISL out on the pitch -- choreographed wonderfully, it was Alia's time. (Photo: ISL) 12/15 Alia and Arjun, kicked things off with a brief performance, dancing to some of her famous hits, which included 'Radha' and 'Disco Deewane' before finishing her performance with 'C'mon India, Let's Football'. (Photo: ISL) 13/15 Aishwarya, with her husband Abhishek and father-in-law Amitabh watching from the VIP section, came and danced gracefully, with a Tamil number, particularly, cranking up the decibel level. (Photo: PTI) 14/15 However, it was an altogether different ball game when Tendulkar and Rajinikanth entered the stage. (Photo: PTI) 15/15 Nita Ambani then declared the second season open. (Photo: ISL) Also Read ISL 2: Atletico Kolkata put on a show for Pele, beat Kerala ISL 2: Stiven Mendoza trick baffles Goa ISL 2: Kerala, Mumbai in dull stalemate In pics: Indian football team stuck in Ashgabat due to bad weather
